Title: the tenure turbulence

Scene: (Flashback to Series 6, Episode 12, The Egg Salad Equivalency)
Janine’s office. There is a sound on her computer. It opens up an online video.
Leonard: I was reading about this jellyfish that never dies. Instead, it reverts to its asexual state and then grows up again.
My point is, immortality is not only a possibility, it is real.
Oh, my God.
No. I mean, I’ll apply, but I’m not gonna stoop to playing politics.
Excuse me, but I think I’m just as qualified as you are.
Yup.
Mm, not really.
I just keep thinking about how cool it would be if I called my mom and told her that I got tenure at Caltech.
Oh, very. Assuming she takes my call.
I’m not gonna schmooze anybody. I’m gonna let my work speak for itself.
Thank you. I’m a naive idiot, right?
Hey-hey-hey-hey-hey. Mrs. Davis.
Hey.
Yeah. Just thought I’d come down and start getting ready for swimsuit season.
Not that you need it. I bet you look great in a swimsuit.
I’ve got what my father used to call furniture disease. My chest is falling into my drawers. I’m not, uh, familiar with this model. How do I make it start?
Right. This one might be broken.

Got it. Oh. There. Oh, yeah. Yeah, now I’m feeling it. Oh, this is great. I could do this for the rest of my life. Hey, speaking, speaking of things you do for the rest of your life, uh, did I read that you’re on that-that tenure committee?
Well, I’m sure you have a lot of good applicants, I just wanted to say hi and let you know that I’ll be throwing my hat in the ring.
Yeah.
Go away.
Well, look at that. Burned a whole calorie.
Oh, if you, if you like banana bread, I’ve got a-a great recipe. The trick is in, in fresh ground, I’ll e-mail it to you.
That’s enough cardio for me. I’m just gonna stretch out before I hit the weights.
Call someone.
Gentlemen.
Nurse’s office.
Asthma, heart, some kind of attack. I’m fine, though.
Probably not.
Do anything interesting today?
Wait, Sheldon’s going to be there? We all promised we weren’t going to go.
I know. I was hoping to go without anyone finding out.
Oh, that’s nice, but it-it’s just gonna be a room full of boring old men and I’m not sure how much help you’d be.
Oh, yeah. No. Thanks, that would be great help. You realize you might kill some of them.
Well, well, well, Sheldon, fancy meeting you here. I guess the train store in Glendale wasn’t having a cotillion after all. And you, you said you weren’t coming here, either.
Do it.
Way to hit ’em with both barrels.
Okay, okay. Guys, what are we doing here?
Oh, you do what you want, but I don’t want to lose my friends over tenure. Friends are forever.
I’m just gonna go home and let my work speak for itself.
How about it, Sheldon?
No. We cannot lose to that jerk.
Howard: We thought my 90-year-old grandfather had reverted to an asexual state, but the lawsuit from his Jamaican caregiver proved us all wrong.
Show a little compassion, a man died.
You Ph.D’s gonna go suck up like Kripke?
Money from family does come with strings attached.
You guys going to Professor Tupperman’s memorial?
Yeah, you wouldn’t want to look like you guys are brown-nosing the tenure committee, who will all be there. Oh, yeah, that’s what I was hoping for, meerkats.
You could talk some smack about his mother.
Raj: Only if you’re this jellyfish which periodically reverts to a mass of undifferentiated protoplasm.
Well, I believe people do their best work when they feel safe and secure.
Yeah, me neither. It should be about the work. And if I can’t get tenure, I’d like to see you or Sheldon get it.
It would be nice to have the increased income. Stop taking money from my parents.
You have no idea. They buy me a new BMW for my birthday but can I get seat warmers? No. Rajesh, if you want a warm butt, you’re gonna have to pay for it yourself. Well, maybe I will, old man.
And I will return to New Delhi in triumph atop a bejeweled white elephant. And you know what will be on that elephant’s back? A seat warmer. No, Father, you may not have a ride.

Good day, Mrs. Davis. This is Dr. Rajesh Koothrappali from the astrophysics department. Don’t be alarmed, I’m not really in space. Anyhoo, I’d like to take this opportunity to tell you about myself, so sit back, relax and enjoy the following 90-minute video.
Born in New Delhi, the third son of an itinerant gynecologist, I showed early signs of genius. At the age of five I discovered a celestial object which later turned out to be the moon.

Come on, Daddy. All the other scientists have seat warmers. This is so humiliating. I’ve got to get tenure. Okay, let’s meet halfway. How about I cut my cleaning lady down to twice a week? Looks like we’re both going to be living like animals.
Unbelievable. You have some nerve showing up here just to schmooze with the tenure committee.
Excuse me. I’m here to pay my respects to Professor Tupperware, or whatever his name is.
I have a thick accent. You don’t know what I said.
You two should be ashamed of yourselves. Using women to advance your cause with sexuality, and whatever Amy plans on doing.
Well, now it’s biguous. What are you gonna do about it?
You’re right. This is beneath me. Lie your mother was last night.
Yeah, screw it. I’m going in.
Sheldon: If I could keep my Gmail account, I’d be okay with that.
If we’re going to change the topic from jellyfish, I’d be okay with brine shrimp or the history of the unicycle.

Excuse me, the whole tenure system is ridiculous. A guaranteed job for life only encourages the faculty to become complacent. If we really want science to advance, people should have chips implanted in their skulls that explode when they say something stupid.
Pchew!
Raj, don’t dangle false hope in front of Leonard like that.
Pchew! Pchew! Pchew! Pchew!
While I disagree with the premise of tenure, if they gave it to me, it wouldn’t diminish my output. You know, I’m like the sun. Can’t turn this off.
Mm-hmm.
Well put. You know, I must say I go back and forth on this boyfriend-girlfriend thing, but those moments when you worship me really keep you in the running.
My primary concern with being granted tenure is living with an insanely jealous roommate after the fact. I might need to sleep with a gun under my pillow. Or a chainsaw.
Or, the chainsaw.
Sheldon Cooper does not do cozy.
But I suppose it wouldn’t hurt to know who’s on the committee. Let’s see. Oh, Janine Davis. Oh, dear.
Well…
Even you. You’re a slave.
I’m not sure, it could go either way.
Yes, hello. I’m fine. Um, I understand you may have a bad impression of me, so I bought you a gift.
It’s too late. Get ready to like me.
The tragic history of slavery in America. Fun for the whole family.
Um… Well… You are black, right?
Because you want to start watching it right now. Copy that. Let’s see. Up next on the tenure committee is Professor Wu. Well, get ready for the complete works of Jackie Chan.
Barely knew him.
I won’t be able to make our date night this Thursday, so, bad news for you.
First of all, when you say things like that, people think you’re crazy. Second, the reason I’m cancelling is because I have to attend a memorial service for Professor Tupperman.
Eh, it will be. Honestly, if I must endure a long and tedious evening, I’d rather it be with you on date night. But I have no choice. The tenure committee’s going to be there.
Well, now that I think about it, that would be most helpful.
Actually, I meant you could drive me. But if it makes you happy, that other stuff, too.
Okay.
Sad.
Glad.
Bad. However…
Fine. Bad.
You’re here.
So am I. His passing makes me feel bad.
What are you going to do? Take people’s drink orders and get them wrong?
What? Did she do it yet?
Well, that’s a fine how-do-you-do. Don’t just stand there. Take your breasts out.
Are you implying that my girlfriend has no sexuality to exploit?
Okay, because that was not clear.
What? That was ambiguous.
Um…
Well, yes, of course, he wouldn’t like that at all. Last night, I was feeling in need of sexual release when I happened to come across your mother.
I don’t know what you’re doing, but I was about to insinuate that I had coitus with Raj’s mother for a dollar.
What do you think I should do?
I don’t want any more, but let’s go.
Wait. Hold on. I believe screw it, I’m going in is what I said to your mother last night. Don’t worry, I didn’t really say that. I find the concept of coitus ridiculous and off-putting.
(Knock, knock, knock) Mrs Davis? (Knock, knock, knock) Mrs Davis? (Knock, knock, knock) Mrs Davis? I know you’re in there. I saw your car in the parking lot.
I just found out that you recommended myself, Dr. Hofstadter and Dr. Koothrappali to be on the short list for tenure.
I don’t know what you mean by quirks, but, um, I do want to express my gratitude.
No, no. No, I learned my lesson. I understand that was inappropriate.
Anyway, thank you.
Yeah, right on, sister.
Barry: Wemember when we were twying to figuwe out what that smell coming fwom Pwofessor Tupperman’s office was?
Turns out it was Tupperman. Dead at his desk for two weeks.
In wieu of fwowers, the department chair is asking that evewyone donate a bottle of Febweze.
And turned into a puddew of goo. Now, we can either sit awound and cwy over spilt pwofessor, or we can wejoice in the knowwedge that a tenured position has just opened up. I choose to do the watter.
If you need my nose, you’ll find it firmwy wodged up the qectum of the tenure committee.
Hey, Hofstadter. Funny seeing you here for the first time in… ever.
Janine the Machine, wet’s do this!
I guess you got here ewwy to burn off that banana bwead I baked you.
Aw wight, I’m warm. Weady to kick it up a notch?
Are you kidding? I would wove to baby-sit for you.
Nonsense. Childwen wove me. Something about me just makes them waugh and waugh.
Penny: So tenured means a job for life?
You can’t get fired even if you’re bad at it?
Wow, sounds a lot like being a pretty waitress at the Cheesecake Factory.
So, who do you have to schmooze to get this deal?
That’s great. That shows a lot of integrity.
Oh, not really. I was out shopping with Amy. She wanted me to help her find something for this memorial thing.
Well, since Amy’s going, do you want me there? You know, to support you?
Okay. I’m just gonna tie my shoe while you think about that.
Oh, then you all can get tenure.
I’m here to support my man, just like you.
Amy: Are Rajesh and Leonard competing for it as well?
Do they know they don’t stand a chance ’cause you’re so great?
Or you take advantage of your newfound economic stability and move out, buy a house, get married. start a family.
You know, if you really want tenure, maybe you should cozy up to the people making the decision.
You don’t say.
Is that a problem?
Well you better have a good excuse this time, because trimming Q-tips to fit your ears right is obvious nonsense.
It sounds like a long and tedious evening.
Oh. Well, in that case, perhaps I should come along.
Of course it would. I’m well-versed in academic politics, and as a respected scientist, I can only raise your stock as a candidate.
Let’s go over our emotional responses one last time.
Professor Tupperman is dead, and that makes us?
The fact that there are so many people here tonight doesn’t make us cranky and claustrophobic. It makes us?
Giving Mrs. Davis the box set of Roots was?
No.
I’d like to know why Penny’s here.
She plans on flirting with members of the tenure committee to further Leonard’s cause.

You’re all wasting your time. Sheldon is the most qualified for the job, and no amount of gravity-defying bosom’s going to change that. Seriously, is that tape? Like, how are they staying up like that?
Sheldon!
Well, you’ll always be an academic success, but I seriously question whether you’ll make any more friends.
Should have taken my breasts out while I had the chance.
Bernadette: I think that’s enough wine for now.
Janine: Yep. I got to get a home gym.
All right, I’ll keep an eye out for that.
Yeah, it was delicious. Thank you.
God, they’re everywhere. Come in. Dr. Cooper, how can I help you?
Uh, Dr. Cooper, that’s not necessary.
Why would you think this is an appropriate gift?
This meeting has come to an end.
I could not ask you to do that.
Well, despite your quirks, the three of you are very accomplished in your respective fields.
You didn’t bring another gift, did you?
You’re welcome. (Sheldon attempts a jive handshake) I’m gonna pretend that didn’t happen.
Shelldon (off): (Knock, knock, knock) Mrs Davis? (Knock, knock, knock) Mrs Davis? (Knock, knock, knock) Mrs Davis?
